fields.description:
If a user edits an issue, makes no changes, and clicks "Update", the "Updated" date takes the current date.

This by itself isn't a problem, except the issue is only reindexed if a change has been made. So this updated "Updated" date doesn't find it's way back to the index.

Because of this, users searching on the "Updated" date get results that appear inconsistent. They see one value on the issue but can't search on it because the index contains an older one.

Ideally one of two things should happen:

* Either the issue should be indexed even when no change is made.
* Or the "Updated" date should only be updated when a change occurs.

Thanks!
fields.summary: "Update" action updates "Updated" date even when no change occured

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29809].
  {panel}

+Components:+
# When renaming a *Component* within a project, it automatically applies to all created issues
# However, it is not applied to saved filters. When filters contains *Component* condition, then rename of a component should be applied to those saved JQLs too.

Of course, you can manually go over all saved filters and modify component condition.

+Status:+
# Renaming the *Status* is not applied to saved filters.
# This is happening when changes are made in either of the followings:
#* Active workflow edit of status in Workflows > Diagram tab > Status Editor
#* Issue Attributes > Statuses
# To replicate:
#* Create a save filter with Status for example “Open” and use it in the Filter Results gadget
#* Rename the status “Open” to “Open123”
#* The Filter Results gadget will return error as below
{noformat}
The selected filter filter-10000 has an error: The value 'Open' does not exist for the field 'status'..
{noformat}

JIRA should not allow any renaming of the Status being made or maybe a warning should be shown. Better yet, the saved filter should be able to update itself accordingly.
fields.summary: Renaming of Components and Status is not reflected in Saved Filter JQL

fields.description:
Dear JIRA Support,

We have problem when our JIRA incoming mail server tries to forward some emails to other email account. The exception is :


An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server "JTEL" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"Message appears to have been sent by JIRA. JIRA's mail handler is configured to forward these messages to avoid mail loops."
------------------------

An issue is created right when an email is fetched by JIRA, but on the forwarded email account, we always get an email with the before message. We have had a look at the log files, but there isn't any exception. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Error forwarding email - incoming mail server

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup and Application link between Confluence, JIRA, and Fisheye, using Trusted application
# Register the gadget feed from JIRA to Confluence through _Confluence Admin >> External Gadgets_
# Add _Fisheye Changesets Macro_ in Confluence page through _Insert >> Other Macros >> Fisheye Changesets Macro_
# Upon specifying the repository name, this error message will be displayed
bq. An internal server error occurred when requesting resource.
!fisheye-jira.png!

h4. Workaround
h5. In JIRA:
# Go to Administration > System > General Configuration > Edit Configuration
# Disable *Use gzip compression* > Update

h5. In user's or client's end
Flush the browser cache. Otherwise the workaround won't work. To verify this, you can simply try it using Chrome's [incognito mode|http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=95464]

| 4.3 | (/) | v5.1.5#784  | (/) | 2.7.10 |  6.0.3 | (x) | (x) |

h5. Test notes
- Confluence <-> JIRA = AppLink
- JIRA <-> FishEye = AppLink
- Each Atlassian app is located in different machine/box
- All mentioned gadgets can be added in JIRA without any problem
- Problem only occured when adding the gadget in Confluence, it can't be saved in the macro browser. For gadgets that has been added in Confluence, it'll still appear without any problem.
- When GZIP is disabled in JIRA. Problem will not occur. This requires flushing browser cache. Force refresh through Shift+ReloadButton doesn't work for some reason. You need to flush it manually. Or simply try with Chrome [Incognito mode|http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=95464] to see the result. re: JRA-28930
- When GZIP is enabled in JIRA. Problem will occur straight away without having to flush browser cache. re: JRA-28930
- For some reason the {{java.io.EOFException}} stacktrace will only be thrown once.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29786].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA's SOAP API that allows an attacker who has a valid JIRA account to overwrite any files that are writeable by the OS user JIRA runs under. This may result in the attacker being able to execute arbitrary Java code in the context of JIRA server.

All versions of JIRA up to and including 5.1.4 are affected by this vulnerability. The vulnerability is fixed in JIRA 5.1.5 and later

For more details see advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2013-02-21

Patches

||Version ||File ||
|5.0.7|[patch-JRA-29786-5.0.7.zip|		http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/patch-JRA-29786-5.0.7.zip] |
|5.1.4|[patch-JRA-29786-5.1.4.zip|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/patch-JRA-29786-5.1.4.zip] |
fields.summary: File overwrite via SOAP API

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior:

The XML generated is invalid since dates in {{customfield}} have accented chars.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Add a date custom field
# Ensure that the database, file encoding and application server are all using the utf-8 encoding as per the guide in [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Internalisation+and+Encoding+Troubleshooting]
# Change the default language of your JIRA instance to French for example
# Choose a sample issue and set the value of the new custom field to "1 February 2012" (in french 1er février 2012)
# Display the updated issue in the navigator
!screenshot-1.jpg|thumbnail!
# click on the view/xml menu
!screenshot-2.jpg|thumbnail!
# The browser displays this error message
!screenshot-3.jpg|thumbnail!

The problem is probably due to the fact that *com.atlassian.jira.datetime.DateTimeVelocityUtils.formatRSS(Date)* method referenced in xml-date.vm does not escape accented characters in a consistent manner. 

h4. Expected behavior:

Have the XML properly encoded for those characters.

h4. Workaround: 

No workarounds available.
fields.summary: XML view generates invalid XML for date customfield in languages that use accented characters for the months - regression

fields.description:
It should be possible for us to export search result in the Issue Navigator into Excel file. However, if we perform a very long JQL search, it seems that the Excel export tool breaks. This looks like a limitation of the Excel Export tool. 

Basically, if we enter a very long JQL query (roughly around 5480 characters), the results returned will be correct. However if we try to export the data into Excel file, the following error will be displayed in IE browser:
!scshot1.png!
(i) the error message: Error in the JQL Query: Expecting ')' before the end of the query

However if we access JIRA via Google Chrome, the web page will become blank and nothing will happen. No Excel file will be exported:
!scshot2.png!

There's no error reported in the logs when it happened. If I slightly reduce the JQL query character count (tested with 5463 characters), the Excel export works again.
fields.summary: JIRA is unable to export search result to Excel file due to very long JQL query characters

fields.description:
For ScreenShot Attachment, below page pops up.
{{http://jira/secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa?id=11107&decorator=popup}}

In this page, there are two text fields.
- File Name
- Update Comment

Bugs are valid for *both* fields.

# In Chrome, every key strokes are broken into piece by piece.

## For the first try(first focus on the field), it accepts DBCS(Korean).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29755].
  {panel}

The current JIRA configuration tool generates old-style Oracle JDBC URLs that specify a SID. This can be problematic for two reasons:

# High-availability clusters can only be connected to using the service name using a newer URL syntax
# The Oracle documentation says that the old syntax is no longer supported as of 10g

Please update the configuration tool to generate the service name type URLs. Right now customers like us who are using HA configurations are forced to edit dbconfig.xml by hand.

More info:
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/java.112/e16548/urls.htm#BEIDHCBA
http://www.orafaq.com/wiki/JDBC#Thin_driver
fields.summary: Configuration tool should generate thin-style service name Oracle JDBC URLs

Currently it is not possible for the JIRA issue collector to create issues with 'Anonymous' reporter.

To reproduce:
* Set JIRA to allow Group (Anyone) to create issues within your project
* Set the Field configuration, setting the *Reporter* field to be optional
* Create a new Issue Collector
* Notice the red asterick( * ) that still indicates the *Issue Reporter* field being required
* Leaving the field blank and trying to proceed with the creation results in error:
{code}Please enter default reporter create issues in project.{code}

Note: users can still anonymously create issues via Issue Collector, but the result is that the Reporter is still to a defined default user.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector does not allow for the Reporter field being 'Anonymous'

fields.description:
h2. How to reproduce

# Open an Issue page.
# Press "m" key to open comment box.
# Type something in comment box.
# Press Ctrl + Enter to use "AJAX post comment" shortcut.
# Press "m" key again to open a new comment box.
# Type something in new comment box.
# Press Ctrl + Enter.

h2. Expected

Another "AJAX post comment" is fired and the comment is posted.

h2. Actual

Nothing happens.

h2. Summary

It appears the functionality only works when you initially load the page -- i.e. you can only post 1 comment in that way for any given page load.
fields.summary: Ctrl + Enter "submit comment on issue" shortcut only works once when page is initially loaded

fields.description:
When using JIRA with default language set to Swedish there is a JavaScript bug when trying to view the calendar for a field with the date populated. 

This happens because we try to call Date.parseDate before the Calendar is properly set up and Calendar._SMN is still undefined. 

Repro steps:
- Set language to Swedish
- In issue navigator, enter a date in one of the date search fields
- Search for issues
- Click on the calendar icon next to the date entered - calendar doesn't load
(note if you click on the calendar for an empty field, then the populated one, it works because then Calendar._SMN is populated)
fields.summary: Calendar breaks in Swedish because short day names / month names are not defined

fields.description:
We recently upgraded from 5.0 to 5.1.2 and I've noticed this behavior.

Use case:
1. Create a new ticket (or edit an existing ticket)
2. Try to drag a file from Finder and drop it into the "Attachment" text box (which is a feature Safari has supported for years).
3. It populates with the file path, however, it JIRA 5.0 it would also immediately start uploading (nice!).  Now in 5.1.2., it no longer automatically starts uploading and in fact when you submit the form, it doesn't upload at all.  You must now click "Browse" and select it in the selection dialog (boo!).

Browser version:
Safari Version 6.0 (7536.25) running on Mac OS X 10.7.4.
fields.summary: Uploading attachments from Safari no longer allows drag/drop

If the issue arises again, I will add screen shots.

fields.description:
Please refer to this issue
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-136557

Basically in my scenario I have a recipient, a@domain.com, where users send their requests. This recipient is in fact a distribution list, which in turn delivers to the b@domain.com mailbox.

Jira is also set up NOT to sync distribution groups with Active Directory. Users/mailboxes are synced, though.

Now, if in Jira I have a jira-only user called a@domain.com, with address a@domain.com, then for every request received Jira will add a@domain.com to its watcher list.

The unfortunate consequence is that every time a request is commented on, Jira sends an email notification to itself, thus clogging the request system.

This is a corner-case, I reckon, but still this shouldn't happen.

Deleting the jira-internal a@domain.com user stops the error from happening.
fields.summary: If the mail recipient of an issue is also a jira internal user, then it is added as a watcher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29701].
{panel}
h5. Steps to reproduce :
 * Create a dashboard
 * Share the dashboard with a specific group that you are a member of.
 * Login as Administrator, remove the user that shared the dashboard from the group they share it with.
 * User will be able to see his dashboard but can't edit it.

h5. Expected :
 * User still be able to edit his dashboard since they are the owner of the dashboard.

h5. Workaround :
 * Login as the sysadmin user
 * Navigate to System> Shared dashboards and search for the dashboard that the user is not able to access
 * Now click on the gear icon and then "Change Owner"
 * Change the dashboard ownership to another administrator user. You will only be able to pick a user that is member of all the groups that the dashboard is shared with.
 * Now check if the new owner is able to edit the dashboard
 * After this, login with the new dashboard owner and change the shares of the dashboard to only include the groups/roles that the original user is member of.
 * Now change the owner of the dashboard back to the original user. The user should now be able to edit the dashboard.
fields.summary: When you remove the user from the group that shared the dashboard with, user will not be able to edit their own dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29700].
  {panel}

*Scenario of the issue*
# The *Original Estimate* of an issue is set to *1d*
# User accidentally log work with the value of *0,25h*. Hence the work log is automatically takes the *Time Spent* as *3d 1h* and the *Remaining Estimate* is automatically set to *0*
# Hence, the user edits the work log from the *Work Log* tab and adjust the *Time Spent* again to correct *0.25h* and in addition to that, *Remaining Estimate* is set again to *1d*
# Sometimes the customer might forget the original value of *Original Estimate*. The workaround is to check on the *History* tab for the original value.


Some improvements that can be made include:
- Perform check for invalid characters and values such as *0,25h*
- Introduce a button to grab the *Original Estimate* that is entered in the beginning rather than checking through the *History* tab
fields.summary: Work Log auto correction of Remaining Estimate and error checking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29699].
  {panel}

Hi,

I thought I'd suggest this new feature to you.

Often, at least for us, there are several releases to an internal test environment before it finally reaches production. Our customers are not very keen on browsing several release notes, when all they know is that their system was just upgraded from v1.1 to v1.2.5. They only want to read up on the delta change, which in this case would be a compilation of release 1.2, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 1.2.3, 1.2.4 and 1.2.5.

Well... for you to consider!

Cheers,
--peter
fields.summary: As a deployment manager I want to compile release notes to reflect a delta change of an environment

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29690].
  {panel}

Assignee user-picker shows user email in Suggestions section, with User Email Visibility set to hidden.
Steps to reproduce:
# Email Visibility set to show user emails
# Assign issue to test user
# Set Email Visibility to Hidden
# Go to assign issue and search for user in the Assignee field

Previous assignees will show up in the Suggestions section of the user-picker with user accounts email showing.
fields.summary: User email showing in suggestions section with visibility set to hidden
Ability to search for issues that don't have sub-tasks

1. Create a new dashboard with the name <script>alert("XSS")</script>
2. Go to the issue navigator and perform a search

This is because portal.name is unescaped in savetodashboard.vm.

Tested in OnDemand and BTF.

fields.description: If there is an error in connecting to the Crowd directory while performing the test from within JIRA for the directory, the error messages that are thrown are not formatted correctly. It contains HTML contents being rendered in text format. See screenshot for an example.
fields.summary: Unformatted Exception Messages Shown During Crowd Directory Testing

fields.description:
When a user logins or fails to login JIRA updates a number of attributes that are stored in the CWD_USER_ATTRIBUTES table.  Because of the SPI contract multiple values may be stored against any attribute and JIRA handles this situation by deleting all the values associated with this user_id attribute_name pair and then inserting the new values.

This behaviour not thread safe and when same user (or more typically a bot) logs in multiple times concurrently, can result in multiple rows beig stored for each attribute and for counts, e.g. login.count, being either incorrect or randomly reset to zero.
fields.summary: The JIRA implementation used to store login details is not thread safe.

fields.description:
When a user logins or fails to login JIRA updates a number of attributes that are stored in the CWD_USER_ATTRIBUTES table.  Because of the SPI contract multiple values may be stored against any attribute and JIRA handles this situation by deleting all the values associated with this user_id attribute_name pair and then inserting the new values.

This behaviour is very poorly handled by postgresql. This behaviour is greatly exacerbated by bots which may use basic auth and authenticate with each incoming request, resulting in thousands of logins for the same user per day.
fields.summary: The JIRA implementation used to store login details leads to sever performance degradations in some databases.

fields.summary: Failure to create a remote issue link between JAC and EAN and vice versa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29676].
  {panel}

See screenshot. The message reads:

Instead we recommend using an external database, for a list of supported databases please see our documentation

It should read:

Instead we recommend using an external database, for a list of supported databases please see our documentation.
fields.summary: Missing period in HSQL DB warning message
Notification scheme links can be confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29673].
  {panel}

h3. Current Situation
The permission 'Browse Project' sets whether or not the user can view the project overview and the issues within. If the user is not granted the 'Browse Project' permission, he/she cannot view both the overview and the issues.

h3. Improvement Request
Add a new project permission that separates viewing the project overview from the issues. This way, a user can view the overview of the project without being able to view the issues
fields.summary: Permission to allow user to view Project Overview but not the Issues
